template.stem: In a right triangle with legs {{a}} and {{b}}, what is the length of the hypotenuse?
template.explanation: Using a 3-4-5 right triangle scaled by k: hypotenuse = 5k.

template.stem: What is the distance between points ({{x1}}, {{y1}}) and ({{x2}}, {{y2}})?
template.explanation: Distance = √(Δx²+Δy²) = √((3k)²+(4k)²) = 5k.

template.stem: What is the midpoint of the segment with endpoints ({{x1}}, {{y1}}) and ({{x2}}, {{y2}})? (Give as an ordered pair.)
template.explanation: Midpoint formula: ((x1+x2)/2, (y1+y2)/2).

template.stem: For segment from ({{x1}}, {{y1}}) to ({{x2}}, {{y2}}), what is the slope of the perpendicular bisector?
template.explanation: Perpendicular slope is the negative reciprocal: m_perp = −1/m_seg = −dx/dy.

template.stem: A triangle has base {{b}} and height {{h}}. What is its area?
template.explanation: Area = 1/2 · base · height.

template.stem: In a right triangle with legs {{a}} (opposite θ) and {{b}}, and hypotenuse {{c}}, what is sin(θ)?
template.explanation: sin(θ) = opposite/hypotenuse = a/c = 3/5.

template.stem: In a right triangle with legs {{a}} (opposite θ) and {{b}} (adjacent θ), what is tan(θ)?
template.explanation: tan(θ) = opposite/adjacent = a/b = 3/4.

template.stem: A circle has radius {{r}}. What is its area in terms of π (give the coefficient multiplying π)?
template.explanation: Area = πr², so the coefficient is r².

template.stem: A sector of a circle with radius {{r}} has central angle {{theta}}°. What is its area in terms of π (give the coefficient multiplying π)?
template.explanation: Sector area = (θ/360)·πr² ⇒ coefficient is (θ/360)·r².

template.stem: In a circle of radius {{r}}, the central angle is {{theta}}°. What is the arc length in terms of π (give the coefficient multiplying π)?
template.explanation: Arc length = (θ/360)·2πr ⇒ coefficient is (θ/180)·r.

template.stem: Points A({{x1}}, {{y1}}) and B({{x2}}, {{y2}}) are endpoints of a diameter of a circle. What is the radius length?
template.explanation: Diameter length = √((6k)²+(8k)²) = 10k ⇒ radius = 5k.

template.stem: A parallelogram has base {{b}} and height {{h}}. What is its area?
template.explanation: Area of a parallelogram = base × height.

template.stem: A trapezoid has bases {{b1}} and {{b2}} and height {{h}}. What is its area?
template.explanation: Trapezoid area = (1/2)(b₁+b₂)h.

template.stem: A rectangle has side lengths {{s}} and {{t}}. What is the length of its diagonal?
template.explanation: Diagonal forms a right triangle: d = √(s²+t²) = 5k.

template.stem: A right circular cylinder has radius {{r}} and height {{h}}. What is its volume in terms of π (give the coefficient multiplying π)?
template.explanation: Volume = πr²h, so the coefficient is r²h.

template.stem: A right circular cone has radius {{r}} and height {{h}}. What is its volume in terms of π (give the coefficient multiplying π)?
template.explanation: Volume = (1/3)πr²h ⇒ coefficient is r²h/3.

template.stem: What is the slope of the line through ({{x1}}, {{y1}}) and ({{x2}}, {{y2}})?
template.explanation: Slope m = (y₂−y₁)/(x₂−x₁).

template.stem: A line with slope {{m}} passes through ({{x0}}, {{y0}}). What is its y-intercept b?
template.explanation: Using y = mx + b ⇒ b = y₀ − m x₀.

template.stem: For a circle centered at ({{h}}, {{k}}), the point T({{xT}}, {{yT}}) lies on the circle. What is the slope of the tangent line at T?
template.explanation: Radius to T has slope dy/dx. Tangent is perpendicular ⇒ slope = −1/m_radius = −dx/dy.

template.stem: An inscribed angle intercepts an arc of {{arc}}°. What is the measure of the inscribed angle?
template.explanation: Inscribed angle equals half the measure of its intercepted arc.

template.stem: In a triangle, an exterior angle measures {{E}}°. One of the remote interior angles is {{a}}°. What is the measure of the other remote interior angle?
template.explanation: Exterior angle equals sum of the two remote interior angles: E = a + b ⇒ b = E − a.

template.stem: A figure has area {{A0}}. After a dilation with scale factor {{s}}, what is the new area?
template.explanation: Areas scale by the square of the scale factor: A = A₀·s².

template.stem: Two right triangles are similar. If one triangle has acute angles {{A}}° and {{B}}° (with {{A}} < {{B}}), what is the measure of the angle corresponding to {{A}}° in the other triangle?
template.explanation: Corresponding angles in similar triangles are equal, so it remains {{A}}°.

template.stem: Square P has side x. Square Q’s perimeter is {{k}} greater than P’s perimeter. Let f(x) be the area of Q. What is f(x)?
template.explanation: Perimeter(P)=4x. If Perimeter(Q)=4x+{{k}}, then side(Q)=x+{{k}}/4 ⇒ Area = (x+{{k}}/4)^2.

template.stem: In a circle, the measure of arc RS is {{arc}}°. What is the measure of the central angle ROS?
template.explanation: Central angles equal their intercepted arcs.

template.stem: An isosceles right triangle has hypotenuse {{H}}. What is its perimeter?
template.explanation: If legs are L, hypotenuse = L√2 ⇒ L = H/√2. Perimeter = H + 2L = H + 2(H/√2).

template.stem: A circle has center ({{h}}, {{k}}) and radius {{r}}. What is its equation? (Provide as (x−h)^2+(y−k)^2=r^2 coefficient tuple [h,k,r^2].)
Triangles ΔABC and ΔDEF are similar with scale factor {{s}} (from ABC to DEF). If AB={{AB}}, what is DE?
template.explanation: Corresponding sides scale by the similarity factor.

template.stem: A circle has diameter endpoints ({{x1}}, {{y1}}) and ({{x2}}, {{y2}}). What is the radius?
template.explanation: Radius is half the diameter length.

template.stem: What is the measure of each interior angle of a regular {{n}}-gon?
template.explanation: Interior angle = ((n−2)·180)/n.

template.stem: Point P({{x}}, {{y}}) is reflected across the x-axis. What are the coordinates of P′?
template.explanation: Reflection across x-axis negates y-coordinate.

template.stem: In a 30-60-90 triangle, the shorter leg is {{s}}. What is the hypotenuse?
Two parallel lines cut by a transversal create a corresponding angle of {{a}}°. What is the measure of the matching corresponding angle?
template.explanation: Corresponding angles are congruent.

template.stem: A sphere has radius {{r}}. What is its volume in terms of π (give the coefficient multiplying π)?
template.explanation: V = (4/3)πr³ ⇒ coefficient is (4/3)r³.
